alert.note: Alert for Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 3:21PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Heavy Rain and Rising River Levels This Weekend... Moderate to heavy rainfall over the next several days is forecast over the Seward Peninsula and western Brooks Range, as the remnants of post-tropical typhoon Merbok track northeastward through the Bering Strait. Expect three-day rainfall totals (Today through Sunday night) around 3 inches at Red Dog Mine, around 5 inches in the peaks of the Kigluaik and Bendeleben Mountains and peaks of the western Brooks Range. Rivers and streams draining these areas could see significant rises, with potential for minor flooding along smaller creeks and streams including tributaries of the Noatak, Kobuk, Kivalina, Wulik, Snake and Niukluk Rivers.
